school_lesson_subtitle1: Read the story to unlock the challenge. Take all the time you need and you can always redo them if you need to.
school_story_midpoint_subtitle: Hey! You are already half way through. Nice!
school_story_end1_subtitle: Good job! Now you can do the challenge to test what you learned. Remember that you can always redo the story if you dont recall everything.
school_story_1.1_screen_1_title: Money is really just pieces of paper. It's us humans who have decided what money should be worth.
school_story_1.1_screen_1_subtitle: Money is what is called a legal tender.
school_story_1.1_screen_2_title: In the past, before there even was money, people exchanged things with each other. It was called barter!
school_story_1.1_screen_2_subtitle: Have you exchanged something with a friend or sibling?
school_story_1.1_screen_3_title: If you happened to be good at baking, but wanted meat as well, you could exchange your bread for meat with a butcher.
school_story_1.1_screen_4_title: But you couldn't exchange one loaf of bread for just anything, some things were worth more.
school_story_1.1_screen_5_title: What do you think is worth the most?
school_story_1.1_screen_8_title: If you wanted to exchange bread for something that was worth more, you would have to agree with the other vendor how many loaves of bread it was worth.
school_story_1.1_screen_8_subtitle: But how would you calculate it?
school_story_1.1_screen_9_title: Well, the worth of things is usually determined by how expensive the raw materials or parts of it are.
school_story_1.1_screen_10_title: To bake bread you need flour, yeast, water and maybe some other things.
school_story_1.1_screen_10_subtitle: Those are the raw materials for bread.
school_story_1.1_screen_11_title: Another example is fabric and thread to sew clothes. The raw materials for clothes are more expensive than the raw materials for bread.
school_story_1.1_screen_11_subtitle: But when determining the worth you also have to take into account how hard it is and how long it takes to make.
school_story_1.1_screen_12_title: In our example, it takes longer time to sew a pair of pants than baking a loaf of bread.
school_story_1.1_screen_12_button_1_titl: Oh! That's why pants are more expensive
school_story_1.1_screen_13_title: So if you had bread but wanted to barter for a pair of pants, you would have to exchange a couple of loaves for the other person to be satisfied.
school_story_1.1_screen_13_button_2_titl: I don't want any more pants
school_story_1.1_screen_14_title: Today, there are also some other things to take into account when you determine or calculate value. But we will talk about that some other time!
school_story_1.1_screen_14_subtitle: These were the basics to what money and value are.
school_story_1.2_screen_1_title: It worked to exchange and barter bread for meat and other goods for a while...
school_story_1.2_screen_1_subtitle: ...but when people started to travel more, it became a hassle to carry around so much bread.
school_story_1.2_screen_2_title: And some goods like bread or meat go bad and mold pretty fast.
school_story_1.2_screen_2_subtitle: That's why people started using legal tender instead!
school_story_1.2_screen_3_title: Legal tender is what you give a seller instead of exchanging an item.
school_story_1.2_screen_3_subtitle: If you bought pants for money, you used legal tender!
school_story_1.2_screen_4_title: In the past they used some weird things before money was invented. It could be stones, sea shells or whale teeth for example.
school_story_1.2_screen_5_title: Yeah, you're right, whale teeth sound a bit gross to keep in your pocket. People were probably relieved when they started making legal tender in silver and gold instead.
school_story_1.2_screen_5_subtitle: Can you guess what that was?
school_story_1.2_screen_8_title: When the first coins were made, they made them out of silver or gold. You knew how much the coins were worth by weighing them.
school_story_1.2_screen_8_subtitle: That's where the saying “Worth its weight in gold“ comes from!
school_story_1.2_screen_9_title: What do you think, doesn't it seem easier to carry a bag of coins than several sacks of bread?
school_story_1.2_screen_10_title: Coins were used for a long time, we still use them! But when people started to own a lot of coins, it got heavy!
school_story_1.2_screen_10_subtitle: They were also easy to steal. So banks started storing people's coins in exchange for written receipts.
school_story_1.2_screen_11_title: When you wanted to buy things, you just paid with the receipts. As the receipts became widely used, they decided to make bills. Those are the same bills we use today.
school_story_1.2_screen_12_title: It might sound a bit funny, but like I said before, it's us people that have decided how much coins and bills should be worth.
school_story_1.2_screen_13_title: That's why we can pay with bills even though they are really just pieces of paper, which are cheap to make.
school_story_1.2_screen_13_button_1_titl: I have a lot of paper...
school_story_1.2_screen_14_title: Yes, so, the bills we use to pay for expensive things...
school_story_1.2_screen_14_subtitle: ...are made of the same thing as toilet paper!
school_story_1.3_screen_1_title: Today it's unusual to pay with coins and bills. But when your parents were your age, they couldn't pay with their phones! They had to pay with cash.
school_story_1.3_screen_1_button_1_title: You couldn't pay with your phone?
school_story_1.3_screen_2_title: That's how it was. There were even more coins than today!
school_story_1.3_screen_2_subtitle: Have you paid with coins or bills in the store?
school_story_1.3_screen_3_title: Well, today most money is digital. It exists as digital information stored in a computer at the bank. But it's still legal tender.
school_story_1.3_screen_3_subtitle: Let's pretend you have a 50pb banknote.
school_story_1.3_screen_4_title: If you deposit it in the bank, they will take your bill. But you will still have 50 piggybucks, just in a <bold>digital form</bold>.
school_story_1.3_screen_4_button_1_title: How do you use them then?
school_story_1.3_screen_5_title: If you want to use your digital money to buy something, you use a bank card.
school_story_1.3_screen_6_title: You can get the card from a bank for example.
school_story_1.3_screen_6_subtitle: Money just doesn't show up in the bank or your account, someone has to deposit them there first.
school_story_1.3_screen_7_title: When the money is in the account you can't hold it in your hand, but it's really the same thing anyway.
school_story_1.3_screen_9_title: The amount of money you have in your account is called balance.
school_story_1.3_screen_10_title: It's a little tricky to keep track of your money when you can't hold it in your hand or keep it in a wallet.
school_story_1.3_screen_10_subtitle: But you can learn how! One way to do so is to make a budget.
school_story_1.3_screen_10_button_1_titl: I have a wallet but no money...
school_story_1.3_screen_11_title: A budget as you might already know is a structure and plan for how much money you have and how much you spend.
school_story_1.3_screen_12_title: Expenses are what you pay for or buy. Income is the money that you get or earn.
school_story_1.3_screen_13_title: We will talk more about what a budget is and how to make one on another planet.
school_story_1.3_screen_13_button_1_titl: I buy a lot of things
school_story_1.3_screen_14_title: The most important part is to remember how much you spend...
school_story_1.3_screen_14_subtitle: ...and calculate how much you have left. Then you can keep track of your money even if it's digital.
school_story_1.3_screen_14_button_1_titl: I need to learn more about budgets later...
school_story_2.1_screen_1_title: We jump start this planet with a question:
school_story_2.1_screen_1_subtitle: What do you think personal finance really is?
school_story_2.1_screen_2_title: Yes, so private finance is called that, because it is the economy that private individuals have.
school_story_2.1_screen_2_subtitle: So not companies, but the finances ordinary people handle at home.
school_story_2.1_screen_3_title: There are different words for everything that has to do with money that sometimes mean the same thing. Like economics and finance, these words mean about the same thing.
school_story_2.1_screen_3_button_2_title: Do I have to remember the words?
school_story_2.1_screen_4_title: There are a lot of new words when you first learn about economics. I will try to explain them all! But, you can always use the dictionary you if you can’t remember what a word means.
school_story_2.1_screen_4_subtitle: Try now and press the underlined word: Finance, if you have not tried the dictionary before.
school_story_2.1_screen_5_title: Anyway, when you hear that it's important to learn personal finance or as we say here: get Financial Superskills,
school_story_2.1_screen_5_subtitle: it really just means you have to learn how to best manage your money!
school_story_2.1_screen_6_title: Yes, it's really that simple. Well, it can be difficult sometimes, but if you start learning early and practice, it's not that hard!
school_story_2.1_screen_7_title: Virtually everything that has to do with money or spending your money, can be divided into three categories:
school_story_2.1_screen_9_title: Let’s go through them. Do you know what <italic>earning</italic> money actually is?
school_story_2.1_screen_9_button_2_title: Getting money, as a weekly allowance
school_story_2.1_screen_10_title: You make money when you get paid for some work you have done. It is often said that you have made money at work, meaning that you have received a salary.
school_story_2.1_screen_10_subtitle: To win or just get money, is not to earn it, because then you have not done anything to get it.
school_story_2.1_screen_11_title: What does it mean to <italic>save</italic> money?
school_story_2.1_screen_12_title: You save money when you don't spend it, but collect it, so that you have money saved. But it can also be that you save money by buying something cheaper.
school_story_2.1_screen_13_title: What does it mean to <italic>spend</italic> money?
school_story_2.1_screen_14_title: You spend money when you buy things, services or pay for things. When you want something and give money in return.
school_story_2.1_screen_14_subtitle: Sometimes these three categories we went through, flow together. They are dependent on each other. For example, you can not spend money if you don’t have money. You have to earn or save it first!
school_story_2.1_screen_14_button_1_titl: Personal finance may not be that difficult!
school_story_2.1_screen_14_button_2_titl: I think it's a bit messy ..
school_story_2.1_screen_15_title: You have to practice everything in the challenge, that's how it works! When you learn something new, you have to repeat the knowledge.
school_story_2.2_screen_1_title: I'll tell you a little more about the three categories we talked about. We start with saving!
school_story_2.2_screen_1_subtitle: Why do you think you save?
school_story_2.2_screen_2_title: It can actually be for several reasons. But you often save, because you, for example, want to buy something expensive.
school_story_2.2_screen_2_subtitle: It can be so expensive that you can’t afford it, even if you were to spend your entire salary or allowance
school_story_2.2_screen_2_button_1_title: A whole salary? Isn't that a lot?
school_story_2.2_screen_3_title: A salary may sound like a lot, but there are a lot of things that are more expensive.
school_story_2.2_screen_3_subtitle: They can even be more expensive than all the salaries you earn in a year together!
school_story_2.2_screen_3_button_2_title: Yes, a house must cost a lot
school_story_2.2_screen_4_title: The best way is to not spend, and <bold>save</bold> all the money you can. If you save enough, you’ll have enough in the end!
school_story_2.2_screen_4_button_1_title: Did not think of it at first
school_story_2.2_screen_5_title: But you can also save money when you shop. If you buy something cheaper than usual, you usually say that you have saved the money that is left over.
school_story_2.2_screen_5_subtitle: Like saving 5pb if you buy a soda in the store, instead of doing it at a café
school_story_2.2_screen_5_button_1_title: But it's cozy at the café
school_story_2.2_screen_7_title: Imagine if you were to save 5pb on buying something cheaper, and then save it the piggy bank.
school_story_2.2_screen_8_title: Triple-save?  I have no idea how to do that. But I’m sure there’s some way!
school_story_2.2_screen_8_subtitle: But you also need to make money, otherwise you have nothing to save!
school_story_2.2_screen_9_title: Exactly. And now you might get a weekly or monthly allowance. But that's not really making money. Because you probably don't do any work to get it.
school_story_2.2_screen_9_subtitle: Your parents are nice and give it to you so you can learn how to handle money.
school_story_2.2_screen_9_button_2_title: I have to work at home for the money
school_story_2.2_screen_10_title: When you are an adult you don’t get money for free, you have to earn it yourself.
school_story_2.2_screen_10_button_2_titl: I want to be a child forever
school_story_2.2_screen_11_title: Do you remember what the last category was, that we should talk about a little more?
school_story_2.2_screen_12_subtitle: But first there will be a challenge!
school_story_2.3_screen_1_title: I see you are here again now!
school_story_2.3_screen_1_subtitle: But ... I forgot what we were talking about! Do you remember?
school_story_2.3_screen_2_title: No, but it was something about money. Although everything we talk about is about money…
school_story_2.3_screen_2_subtitle: Now I remember! It was spending!.
school_story_2.3_screen_3_title: Sorry. I'm a little confused sometimes. It's like that when you're a financial pig-xpert and always think about that.
school_story_2.3_screen_3_subtitle: But yes, spending. It's my favorite of the three. Is it yours too?
school_story_2.3_screen_4_title: I think many people like to spend.
school_story_2.3_screen_4_subtitle: It <bold>is</bold> important to learn the right way though, so you don't waste all your money.
school_story_2.3_screen_4_button_1_title: Yes, because then it is all gone!
school_story_2.3_screen_4_button_2_title: Ehh, you can get more, right?
school_story_2.3_screen_5_title: But it's actually important to spend money too! Did you know that?
school_story_2.3_screen_7_title: Money is exchanged for goods and services, that people shop and pay for things is important for the world economy.
school_story_2.3_screen_7_subtitle: But you should still try to think about your own situation. What's best for you and your finances when deciding whether to buy something or not.
school_story_2.3_screen_8_title: I hope you have a better idea now of ​​what Earning, saving and spending is.
school_story_2.3_screen_9_title: What do I need to do to have money to save and spend?
school_story_2.3_screen_10_title: The correct answer is to earn!
school_story_2.3_screen_10_subtitle: What do I do if I put away money for later?
school_story_2.3_screen_11_title: The correct answer is you save!
school_story_2.3_screen_11_subtitle: Do you think you have done well in this story? In the challenge you will get to practice how the categories are connected!
school_story_3.1_screen_1_title: Like I said in the previous chapter, the price of something depends on how expensive its raw materials are and how long it takes to make.
school_story_3.1_screen_1_subtitle: But it is only one part of the truth.
school_story_3.1_screen_2_title: Because the price of a product also depends on other things.
school_story_3.1_screen_2_subtitle: Products, as you may know, is the word for <bold>things that you can buy</bold>.
school_story_3.1_screen_5_title: Except the raw materials and how long it takes to make, there is  also something called supply and demand that can affect the price.
school_story_3.1_screen_6_title: How much there is of something or how easy it is to get is called:
school_story_3.1_screen_7_title: How many that want to buy the product or how much people want it is called:
school_story_3.1_screen_8_title: You will learn more about supply and demand in the next story, but I want to talk more about price and value right now.
school_story_3.1_screen_10_title: Cost and value are not the same thing even if it seems like it sometimes.
school_story_3.1_screen_10_subtitle: The cost is what you pay for the product. The price of it.
school_story_3.1_screen_11_title: The price is often calculated by adding the cost for raw materials and time it takes to make it, and then that is affected by the supply and demand that I talked about.
school_story_3.1_screen_11_subtitle: But value is a little more complicated.
school_story_3.1_screen_12_title: Maybe you have heard people say that something was “worth the cost“ or “worth paying for.“
school_story_3.1_screen_12_subtitle: But what do they actually mean when they say that?
school_story_3.1_screen_13_title: To understand you have to start by learning that there are two kinds of value: <bold>subjective value</bold> and <bold>objective value</bold>.
school_story_3.1_screen_13_subtitle: Wow, those were also difficult words!
school_story_3.1_screen_14_title: I will explain these words and then you will get to practice in the challenge before I'll continue.
school_story_3.1_screen_15_title: Something is subjective when you see it from your own point of view. When you have an opinion about it.
school_story_3.1_screen_15_subtitle: So subjective value is what you think an ice cream is worth, for example. You may think that ice cream is worth 30pb in the summer, but not in the middle of winter.
school_story_3.1_screen_16_title: Something is objective when you see it from a point of view that is not personal. So it's usually about facts and not about people's opinion and what they think.
school_story_3.1_screen_16_subtitle: The objective value is often pretty close to the price of a product, otherwise it can be hard to get people to buy it.
school_story_3.1_screen_17_title: On this planet we will talk about objective value, as it is the one that is important when speaking of cost and pricing.
school_story_3.1_screen_17_subtitle: Subjective value we will save for later, when we speak about spending and your personal finances.
school_story_3.2_screen_1_title: Now you will learn more about supply and demand. I know it can be a bit hard, so we will take this whole story for it.
school_story_3.2_screen_2_title: Let's repeat: Demand is how many that want the product or how much they want it...
school_story_3.2_screen_2_subtitle: ...supply is how much there is of something or how easy it is to get.
school_story_3.2_screen_3_title: If there is a large supply of the product, meaning it's easy to find and buy it...
school_story_3.2_screen_3_subtitle: ...then sellers have to lower the price.
school_story_3.2_screen_4_title: Let me give you an example. In Fall, it's apple season because that’s when they ripen. That means apples are easy to get and many have them in their garden.
school_story_3.2_screen_5_title: When it's apple season and they are easy to get, the apples are cheaper.
school_story_3.2_screen_6_title: But in the spring apples are not in season. Sometimes they have to be imported from other countries.
school_story_3.2_screen_6_subtitle: Then the sellers can raise the price because people will buy them anyway, and can’t pick them at home.
school_story_3.2_screen_8_title: With demand it’s the opposite. If many people want something...
school_story_3.2_screen_9_title: But if the demand is low and not that many want to buy the product...
school_story_3.2_screen_9_subtitle: ...they have to lower the price to try and make people buy it.
school_story_3.2_screen_9_button_2_title: I think I understand the difference
school_story_3.2_screen_10_title: An example of demand is when a gaming company is selling a new console. When they release a new one they can set a high price because many people want it.
school_story_3.2_screen_10_button_1_titl: I get that! Who wouldn't want one?
school_story_3.2_screen_10_button_3_titl: I would cue for a long time for the new one
school_story_3.2_screen_11_title: But then they also have to lower the price of the old ones because less people want to buy the old models when there is a new one available.
school_story_3.2_screen_11_button_1_titl: I always want the new one!
school_story_3.2_screen_11_button_2_titl: I'm happy with the older model
school_story_3.2_screen_12_title: The summary you should remember is:
school_story_3.2_screen_12_subtitle:
If the supply is <italic>high</italic> the price is <bold>low</bold>. 
If the demand is <italic>high</italic> the price is <bold>high</bold>.
school_story_3.2_screen_13_title: It's even easier to remember it this way:
school_story_3.2_screen_13_subtitle:
If there is a lot of something and enough for everyone it is cheaper. 
If there is less of something than people that want it, it's more expensive.
school_story_3.2_screen_13_button_2_titl: I think I need to redo this again
school_story_3.3_screen_1_title: How much does something cost? Yes, it may sound easy. But it's a pretty difficult question.
school_story_3.3_screen_1_subtitle: That's why we've talked about value and price before on this planet. And also supply and demand!
school_story_3.3_screen_2_title: You probably understand a little more about <italic>why</italic> things cost differently and that it depends on many things. But now I will try to teach you about <italic>how much</italic> things cost.
school_story_3.3_screen_3_title: I start by asking you, do you think it's good to buy something expensive?
school_story_3.3_screen_4_title: Tricky question! Something can be expensive because it costs a lot of money.
school_story_3.3_screen_4_subtitle: But something can also be expensive because it costs more than usual.
school_story_3.3_screen_5_title: It's better to buy something for a cheaper price, than when the product is more expensive.
school_story_3.3_screen_5_subtitle: If you can afford to buy something, but it costs more than it <italic>usually does,</italic> it's smarter to wait. Buy it when you can find it for a cheaper price.
school_story_3.3_screen_6_title: How do you really know what is expensive or cheap?
school_story_3.3_screen_6_subtitle: The best way is to compare prices!
school_story_3.3_screen_8_title: It is good to learn the price of things you buy often. Then you know what it usually costs and can compare the price on different occasions.
school_story_3.3_screen_9_title: If you are going to buy something you do not know the price of, you can check in different stores what their prices are.
school_story_3.3_screen_9_button_1_title: Sounds like a lot of work ...?
school_story_3.3_screen_10_title: No! You can actually do it very fast with the internet, chilling on the couch!
school_story_3.3_screen_10_subtitle: And once you have checked, you can compare the prices they have in different stores and see if there is a difference.
school_story_3.3_screen_10_button_3_titl: I don't know what I'm doing
school_story_3.3_screen_11_title: When trying to figure out if something is cheap or expensive, it's almost always about comparing prices and products.
school_story_3.3_screen_12_title: You can compare prices on a product, but in different stores.
school_story_3.3_screen_12_subtitle: If you do so, then you only compare the price of the product, because the product is the same
school_story_3.3_screen_13_title: But you can also compare different products, which are similar but cost different.
school_story_3.3_screen_13_subtitle: Then you usually compare a cheaper product with a more expensive one to see if the cheaper one is as good as the more expensive one.
school_story_3.3_screen_14_title: Comparing both price and product is a little harder than just comparing price, but once you learn it's pretty easy!
school_story_3.3_screen_14_subtitle: Go and practice the in challenge, then you will get an example of how it can be done!
school_story_3.4_screen_1_title: You're back! Nice! I promised an example of a situation where you compare both prices and products.
school_story_3.4_screen_2_title: Okay, pretend you want to buy french fries in a food truck.
school_story_3.4_screen_2_subtitle: But first, you want to compare if the price they charge is reasonable.
school_story_3.4_screen_3_title: They also sell ice cream and pizza in the food truck
school_story_3.4_screen_3_button_3_title: Now I'm starting to get hungry
school_story_3.4_screen_4_title: French fries cost 50pb per serving. To compare, look at the prices of ice cream and pizza as well.
school_story_3.4_screen_4_subtitle: A pizza should be more expensive than french fries. An ice cream should be cheaper. Do you know why?
school_story_3.4_screen_5_title: Well, pizza is worth more because the ingredients are more expensive and it takes more time and effort to make!
school_story_3.4_screen_6_title: Ice cream should be cheaper for the same reason.
school_story_3.4_screen_6_subtitle: And the ice cream is also smaller than both the pizza and the french fries.
school_story_3.4_screen_6_button_2_title: Ice cream goes to the dessert belly!
school_story_3.4_screen_7_title:
In the kiosk they charge 85pb for a pizza. 
The ice cream costs 26pb.
school_story_3.4_screen_7_subtitle: Do you think the prices seem fair when comparing the products?
school_story_3.4_screen_9_title: Ice cream is the cheapest, then comes french fries, and pizza is the most expensive.
school_story_3.4_screen_9_subtitle: You pay more for the product that has more raw materials and is harder to make.
school_story_3.4_screen_10_title: We know the prices are fair because we compared the prices between the different products.
school_story_3.4_screen_10_subtitle: But, are the prices they have cheap or expensive ??
school_story_3.4_screen_11_title: No, we can not know without something to compare with!
school_story_3.4_screen_11_subtitle: We need to compare the price with the prices they have at other outlets!
school_story_3.4_screen_12_title: So, then you can compare the prices with the price of french fries in a kiosk nearby.
school_story_3.4_screen_12_subtitle: In the food truck, french fries cost 50pb. In the kiosk next door, they take 67pb. Which place is the cheapest?
school_story_3.4_screen_13_title: The food truck was the cheapest !!
school_story_3.4_screen_13_subtitle: But, as you know, sometimes you have to choose between <bold>price</bold> and <bold>value</bold>.
school_story_3.4_screen_14_title: Yes, sometimes you get more value, something better, if you buy a more expensive product.
school_story_3.4_screen_14_subtitle: Because if you know that the more expensive kiosk has better french fries and larger portions, then maybe you buy the more expensive ones, because it's worth it!
school_story_3.4_screen_15_title: I think it's messy and complicated sometimes, but if you practice in different situations you learn!
school_story_4.1_screen_1_title: Phew! Hi, just give me a second, I just came back from work, and I have to find my glasses to get into my teacher mood!
school_story_4.1_screen_1_button_2_title: I thought this was your job!
school_story_4.1_screen_2_title: Yup, I have a job! This is actually a perfect introduction to the topic of this planet: Earning!
school_story_4.1_screen_2_subtitle: Do you know what earning is?
school_story_4.1_screen_2_button_1_title: When you get money from working!
school_story_4.1_screen_2_button_4_title: Getting paid interest from a savings account!
school_story_4.1_screen_3_title: Was it hard to choose? I was a bit sneaky, because all those answers were right.
school_story_4.1_screen_3_subtitle: They are all ways of earning money!
school_story_4.1_screen_4_title: Yes sorry, but it makes a good point you see? There are many ways of earning money. You probably know that you can earn other things than money.
school_story_4.1_screen_4_subtitle: You can earn money, or praise, a reward or even respect! But we will just talk about earning money.
school_story_4.1_screen_4_button_2_title: I think I earned some praise!
school_story_4.1_screen_4_button_3_title: Can I earn a reward now?
school_story_4.1_screen_5_title: To earn, is to get something in exchange for your work, labor or effort.
school_story_4.1_screen_5_subtitle: That's why all those examples in the beginning were true.
school_story_4.1_screen_5_button_1_title: Can you remind me of them?
school_story_4.1_screen_6_title: You earn a salary when you work, this is probably the clearest and most common example. Same thing with earning money by getting paid for chores.
school_story_4.1_screen_6_subtitle: Chores are a very good way to practice and learn that you actually have to earn your money, not just ‘get’ it.
school_story_4.1_screen_6_button_1_title: Yeah, it’s like a job for kids!
school_story_4.1_screen_8_title: When you earn interest from a savings account, you have done the bank a service because you lend them the money for a while. And it's also an effort to save!
school_story_4.1_screen_8_subtitle: The last one is the one that can be the hardest to understand at first. It was the option ‘selling used things’.
school_story_4.1_screen_9_title: Instead of giving or throwing things away, you can sell them. Selling things is putting effort and time into it. It's earning extra money!
school_story_4.1_screen_9_subtitle: I think you understand earning money and what it is a bit better now. And this is a large part of personal finance!
school_story_4.1_screen_10_title: The three important things to be good at to handle your money well are; Earning, saving and spending. And earning is really a central part.
school_story_4.1_screen_10_subtitle: They are all connected as you will see, so clever earning, nifty saving and smart spending is a killer combo.
school_story_4.1_screen_10_button_1_titl: I think I'm a smart spender
school_story_4.1_screen_10_button_3_titl: I want to practice clever earning
school_story_4.1_screen_11_title: Working somewhere and getting a salary is the most common way to earn money.
school_story_4.1_screen_11_subtitle: Whatever you will do for work, it's good to start early. With practicing I mean. You could do chores, or maybe help the neighbors with something?
school_story_4.1_screen_11_button_1_titl: I already know what job I want!
school_story_4.1_screen_11_button_2_titl: I have no clue what to work with
school_story_4.1_screen_12_title: I will give you some more tips on starting earning money as a child, so you don't have to wait until you grow up!
school_story_4.1_screen_12_subtitle: Not now though, I just saw someone won the lottery on this planet...
school_story_4.1_screen_12_button_1_titl: Oh I want to win money!
school_story_4.1_screen_13_title: It does happen, but honestly luck is not something you should rely on. Take scratchers for example.
school_story_4.1_screen_13_subtitle: Did you know that the chances of winning that much money are so low, that you could buy one every day for the rest of your life, and not win a million?
school_story_4.1_screen_14_title: It's true, it can be calculated using math. Buying one, every day for 60 years, you would spend over half a million!
school_story_4.1_screen_14_subtitle: So, I’d rather rely on earning. Luck is great, but clever earning is reliable and steady, and if you save smart instead, with interest, you could have a million!
school_story_4.1_screen_14_button_2_titl: I will have to check that math...
school_story_4.2_screen_1_title: So, you know that the lottery or relying on luck is not a good strategy for earning.
school_story_4.2_screen_2_title: You might have heard someone say ‘money doesn't grow on trees’?
school_story_4.2_screen_3_title: It's a common saying, which means that you actually have to work for money to earn it.
school_story_4.2_screen_3_subtitle: If you recall from before, to save and spend money, you have to earn it first!
school_story_4.2_screen_4_title: An example of a job is selling products or manufacturing them.
school_story_4.2_screen_4_subtitle: Do you know what manufacturing a product is?
school_story_4.2_screen_5_subtitle: To build or make a product. It can also be to assemble a product.
school_story_4.2_screen_7_title: Anything can be a job if you can earn money from it. Maybe you already have an idea for an invention you can sell?
school_story_4.2_screen_8_title: You are actually allowed to get a job in Sweden if you have turned 13 years of age. Usually during the summer.
school_story_4.2_screen_8_button_4_title: Work during summer? But that's vacation time!
school_story_4.2_screen_9_title: But there are some rules and restrictions, so make sure you know all the rules.
school_story_4.2_screen_10_title: I remember as a teenage piglet, I got my first ever summer job. But I didn't know all the rules and my rights.
school_story_4.2_screen_10_subtitle: So I only got paid 15pb an hour. And that is way way too little, it wasn't according to the law.
school_story_4.2_screen_10_button_1_titl: Yeah sounds like a good thing to know
school_story_4.2_screen_10_button_2_titl: I know the rules already actually!
school_story_4.2_screen_11_title: Even if you have a couple of years left until you turn 13, you can do simpler tasks around the house and in the family to earn money.
school_story_4.2_screen_12_title: Whatever you decide to do, as with many things, it's good to start early, so you get used to it.
school_story_4.2_screen_12_subtitle: I will give you some more tips on starting to earn money as a child, so you don't have to wait until you grow up to start earning money!
school_story_4.2_screen_12_button_1_titl: Yes! I want to know more
school_story_4.2_screen_13_title: I'll tell you after you have done the challenge!
school_story_4.3_screen_1_title: Ready to learn some mad skills for earning money as a kid?
school_story_4.3_screen_2_title: The first tip is about working, as that is the most standard way to earn money. ‘But hey Piggy’, you might say, ‘I am not old enough to get a job yet’.
school_story_4.3_screen_2_subtitle: Well, that doesn't mean you can't work and earn money! Because if you do chores and get paid, that means you are earning money!
school_story_4.3_screen_2_button_2_title: I can start earning that way?
school_story_4.3_screen_3_title: Yup! So the first tip is to set up some chores and maybe come up with what could help your parents, and start earning!
school_story_4.3_screen_3_subtitle: If you want to, you can do chores every week to have a steady income, or you can do different things in different weeks. It's up to you and your parents.
school_story_4.3_screen_3_button_2_title: I already do chores, how can I earn more?
school_story_4.3_screen_4_title: Okay so the second is to try and find more things to help out with outside your home. You could check with your grandparents for example.
school_story_4.3_screen_4_subtitle: And you can ask neighbors if you could help them in exchange for payment, but ask your parents first if they think it's okay!
school_story_4.3_screen_5_title: Well if you don't want to do that, you could do tip number 3.
school_story_4.3_screen_5_subtitle: You can have a yard sale!
school_story_4.3_screen_6_title: Go through your stuff and take the things you don't use anymore. Selling used things is also good for the environment!
school_story_4.3_screen_6_subtitle: But always check with your parents. And while you are at it, you can ask if they have anything they want to donate to the yard sale!
school_story_4.3_screen_6_button_1_title: I know some things I could sell
school_story_4.3_screen_7_title: Now that you have something to sell, you can do it at a flea market, or online.
school_story_4.3_screen_7_subtitle: There are many flea markets where you can rent a table to sell your things, often there are even children's flea markets, just for kids like you!
school_story_4.3_screen_7_button_2_title: I'm a bit too shy for that
school_story_4.3_screen_9_title: Just to be clear,  make sure to check with your parents before you sell things,
school_story_4.3_screen_9_subtitle: Before you really have Financial Superskills and you are a bit older, it's important to ask for permission and advice from them.
school_story_4.3_screen_10_title: My last tip for now, is to earn money by saving!
school_story_4.3_screen_10_subtitle: And maybe it's more a saving or spending tip, but as you put in effort, it could be called earning as well!
school_story_4.3_screen_11_title: So it's about planning and comparing prices before you buy something. And maybe even waiting for a sale.
school_story_4.3_screen_11_subtitle: Let's say that you have a savings goal you set up. You are saving to buy a...
school_story_4.3_screen_12_title: Haha, let's say you save for something simpler, like wireless headphones. While you are saving and waiting to have enough money...
school_story_4.3_screen_12_subtitle: ...you can start comparing prices in different stores. When you know what pair of headphones you want, you can check what store that has the best price.
school_story_4.3_screen_13_title: It is! Sometimes that could save you a lot of money! And if you are patient and extra nifty, you will plan for a sale...
school_story_4.3_screen_13_subtitle: Either plan to buy the headphones during big sales, like Black Friday in November, or during the Christmas sales.
school_story_4.3_screen_13_button_1_titl: Oh no I don't like waiting
school_story_4.3_screen_14_title: Because you made an effort while doing that, you can actually say you earned the money!
school_story_4.3_screen_14_subtitle: One more way to earn money through saving, is when you save money in the bank in an account that pays interest.
school_story_4.3_screen_15_title: The bank also pays you more money the more you save. The correct term for it actually is ”to <bold>earn</bold> interest”.
school_story_4.3_screen_15_subtitle: I will leave you with this. You hopefully have a bunch of things to try to earn some money on now!
school_story_5.1_screen_1_title: Congratulations on reaching this important planet... Remember, the three staples of personal finances are:
school_story_5.1_screen_1_subtitle:
Earning, saving and spending.
You already learned a bit about earning on a previous planet, and here will talk about saving.
school_story_5.1_screen_2_title: Before we go on about saving, I wanted to explain another word to you! You know what a product is, it's a thing you can buy. But what about something you buy that is not a thing?
school_story_5.1_screen_3_title: Like Netflix, which is a streaming <bold>service</bold>. Or if you go to a store and pay someone to fix your broken screen on the phone, then you buy a service.
school_story_5.1_screen_3_subtitle: But let’s move on! Do you save any money?
school_story_5.1_screen_4_title: You probably already know what saving means, but I would like to explain it a bit deeper.
school_story_5.1_screen_4_subtitle: If you save money that's great. If you don't, you should really start doing it!
school_story_5.1_screen_5_title: Saving is, in its most basic form, very simple. It just means that you keep more than you spend.
school_story_5.1_screen_6_title: Remember when we talked about history? That at some point in time, people only used coins?
school_story_5.1_screen_6_subtitle: Some people had trouble carrying the weight of all their coins,because they had saved a lot!
school_story_5.1_screen_6_button_1_title: Saving money was even harder work back then!
school_story_5.1_screen_8_title: You can see it clearly when you save coins and bills in a piggybank in your house. The money stash grows every time you save money instead of spending it!
school_story_5.1_screen_8_subtitle: I love seeing the money growing in the piggybank.
school_story_5.1_screen_8_button_1_title: I love it when the piggy bank fills up!
school_story_5.1_screen_9_title: But you can actually see it in the piggy bank in the Gimi app as well.
school_story_5.1_screen_9_subtitle: When you count your savings or what you spend, it is actually very simple math. Only addition and subtraction.
school_story_5.1_screen_10_title: You probably know that everything can be added and subtracted in the same way. Doesn't matter if it is apples, Robux or money.
school_story_5.1_screen_10_subtitle: Let's see if you remember what the words mean... What is addition?
school_story_5.1_screen_10_button_2_titl: It's when you take away things
school_story_5.1_screen_10_button_4_titl: It's when you eat the apples
school_story_5.1_screen_11_title: It's when you add things! If you have 5 apples, you add 2 and get 7, that's called addition in math.
school_story_5.1_screen_11_button_2_titl: It's when you take away things
school_story_5.1_screen_11_button_4_titl: It's when you eat the apples
school_story_5.1_screen_12_title: It's when you take away, or subtract things! If you have 5 apples and take away 2, you have 3 left. That's called subtraction in math.
school_story_5.1_screen_12_button_1_titl: Yes, yes. I know all this!
school_story_5.1_screen_13_title: I know that this might be very simple for you, but I wanted to explain it, just in case.
school_story_5.1_screen_13_subtitle: Also to make you understand that when handling money you use math to count everything.
school_story_5.1_screen_13_button_1_titl: Ok. I’ll do the challenge now.
school_story_5.2_screen_1_title: Let's talk some more about saving. I explained the math words previously, because you need those things here.
school_story_5.2_screen_2_title: You should never spend more than you have, right?
school_story_5.2_screen_3_title: This is where addition and subtraction comes in.
school_story_5.2_screen_3_subtitle: I will use them to explain why you should not spend more money than you have.
school_story_5.2_screen_4_title: If you have 5 apples, you only have those 5 apples. Not more and not less.
school_story_5.2_screen_4_subtitle: And you can’t eat more than 5 apples, because you don't have more.
school_story_5.2_screen_5_title: But if you have a card you pay with, you can sometimes spend more than you have in your bank account. Then you get a negative balance in your account.
school_story_5.2_screen_6_title: It is bad because when you spend more than you have, you actually borrow money from the bank,or somebody else.
school_story_5.2_screen_6_subtitle: And loans cost money. You have to pay for them, like you would any other product or service.
school_story_5.2_screen_7_title: Okay! So, you have 5pb. If you spend 7pb on a candy bar, that means you had to borrow 2pb from the bank.
school_story_5.2_screen_9_title: Then you don’t have any money left <italic>and</italic> you owe the bank 2pb. You might also have to pay interest.
school_story_5.2_screen_9_subtitle: If you keep spending that way, sooner or later you will end up in debt.
school_story_5.2_screen_10_title: By saving, you are adding instead of subtracting.
school_story_5.2_screen_10_subtitle: Of course spending is necessary sometimes, and something you have to do. But you should spend in a smart way.
school_story_5.2_screen_11_title: One way of doing it, is to save up before the purchase.
school_story_5.2_screen_11_subtitle:
Let's say you have the same 5pb from the previous example. You save 3pb every week for three weeks.
5 + 3 + 3 + 3 = 14
school_story_5.2_screen_12_title: Now you have 14pb. If you want to buy that candy bar we talked about for 7pb, you have 7pb left after the purchase!
school_story_5.2_screen_12_subtitle: You could buy the candy and have some money left over. Just because you waited with spending until you had saved up.
school_story_5.2_screen_13_title: That is why saving is important. Spending more than you have can become expensive, and cause a lot of problems.
school_story_5.2_screen_13_subtitle: Always making sure to have some money saved up, is a real Financial Superskill!
school_story_5.2_screen_14_title: Yup, so to summarise this destination's take-away message:
school_story_5.2_screen_14_subtitle: Saving is just putting away money. It means to let the money you have, grow over time. And to earn and save more money than you spend.
school_story_5.3_screen_1_title: Hey, good job on the challenge! I was actually just sitting and sorting the coins in my savings.
school_story_5.3_screen_1_subtitle: I have done some recycling and helping out around my neighbourhood, so I earned some money!
school_story_5.3_screen_1_button_2_title: I haven't earned any money yet...
school_story_5.3_screen_2_title: Okay, well as you learned on the planet about earning, it's great!
school_story_5.3_screen_2_subtitle: I love saving the money I earn, cause I can see it grow, almost like a plant!
school_story_5.3_screen_3_title: I have a savings goal now and can see how I get closer to reaching it, it feels great.
school_story_5.3_screen_3_subtitle: I am trying to decide if I should save the money I earned..
school_story_5.3_screen_4_title: I have had my eye on a space scooter for a while now. It's like a regular scooter but with its own atmosphere.
school_story_5.3_screen_4_subtitle: That means you don't have to wear a space suit while riding it! And it makes the coolest ”bluphbluph”-sound!
school_story_5.3_screen_5_title: We can talk more about the scooter later, but first we will continue talking about saving.
school_story_5.3_screen_5_button_2_title: I want a space scooter too!
school_story_5.3_screen_6_title: I previously explained that saving is important, so that you don't have to spend more than you have, because it is more expensive in the long run.
school_story_5.3_screen_6_subtitle: But it’s also important because you get more money when you save!
school_story_5.3_screen_6_button_1_title: Get more money? I don’t get it
school_story_5.3_screen_6_button_2_title: Well yeah, if you save, you have money. Right?
school_story_5.3_screen_7_title: Well actually, you get <bold>more</bold> money when you save! If you save your money in the bank, in a savings account, you earn interest. You can get more money by saving!
school_story_5.3_screen_7_subtitle: Interest is a sum of money that the bank pays you when you let them keep your money for a while.
school_story_5.3_screen_9_title: Sure thing! The bank pays you money if you promise you will leave the money in your account for a while. You lock them in the account for a while
school_story_5.3_screen_9_subtitle: This means that the longer you keep the money in the account, the more you save there, the more money you get paid!
school_story_5.3_screen_10_title: It’s not very risky, because for savings accounts, there is a guarantee that you will get the money back if something happens to the bank.
school_story_5.3_screen_10_subtitle: There are other ways to save where there is a risk of losing some , but where you also have the chance to earn more money.
school_story_5.3_screen_10_button_1_titl: I want to earn more, tell me how!
school_story_5.3_screen_11_title: Let's wait a bit with those other ways, because there's some more information you need to know before you are ready.
school_story_5.3_screen_11_subtitle: There are many different ways to save, but generally they can be divided into long-term saving and short-term saving.
school_story_5.3_screen_12_subtitle: The simplest way of short-term saving is just to put away your money, and try not to spend it.
school_story_5.3_screen_13_title: It can be pretty hard! But in that way you make sure that you have money for the things you really need or want.
school_story_5.3_screen_13_subtitle: Money disappears quickly when you buy a soda here, an ice cream there...
school_story_5.3_screen_13_button_2_titl: I know, that's why I save!
school_story_5.3_screen_14_title: Long-term saving as you might suspect, just means that you save for a long time.
school_story_5.3_screen_15_title: How long you save, for when you are saving long-term, varies. But usually it’s for several years.
school_story_5.3_screen_15_subtitle: A lot of people, for example, save for their retirement. That is when you get older and stop working. That means you save almost your entire life for that!
school_story_5.3_screen_15_button_2_titl: I have saved for years already
school_story_5.3_screen_16_title: The best way to do it, is to save both short-term and long-term.
school_story_5.3_screen_16_subtitle: You could actually start saving long term already. Start saving for a driver's license or furniture that you will need when you move out of your parents house.
school_story_5.3_screen_16_button_1_titl: But wait, that's a very long time!
school_story_5.3_screen_17_title: Yes, it might feel that way. But you only have to save a little every month. Because you save over a longer period of time, in the end, it will be quite a lot of money anyway!
school_story_5.3_screen_17_subtitle: Let's say you are 10 years old. If you just save 50pb a month, you would have 6000pb in total when you turn 18. The bank would give 1000pb just for saving in their bank.
school_story_5.3_screen_18_title: Anyway, I have decided! I will save up money to buy that space scooter.
school_story_5.3_screen_18_subtitle: I would love some chocolate right now, but I won't buy any. I will save the money for that space scooter.
school_story_6.1_screen_1_title: Oh, you're here! Come and have a look!
school_story_6.1_screen_2_title: I'm watching my transactions for this month!
school_story_6.1_screen_2_subtitle: I always find that so exciting.
school_story_6.1_screen_3_title: Transactions! When you check them, you can see the money you have spent and what you spent it on!
school_story_6.1_screen_3_subtitle: You can also see money that is added to the account. Such as your allowance or gifts. It’s a list of your money going in and out.
school_story_6.1_screen_3_button_2_title: Why do you want to watch it?
school_story_6.1_screen_4_title: Everyone who has a bank account or the piggybank in Gimi can do it!
school_story_6.1_screen_4_subtitle: And I'm looking at my transactions to see what I bought this month. It’s good to keep track of!
school_story_6.1_screen_4_button_1_title: But, don’t you remember what you bought?
school_story_6.1_screen_5_title: If I didn’t buy that many things, I remember. But when I buy a lot of small things like sweets or drinks, it’s easy to quickly forget all purchases!
school_story_6.1_screen_5_subtitle: If you check your transactions from time to time, you can see how much you have spent on different things.
school_story_6.1_screen_5_button_1_title: Still don’t understand why you want to?
school_story_6.1_screen_7_title: It's good to check the transactions. If you save for something expensive and nice, for example, you do not want to spend too much.
school_story_6.1_screen_7_subtitle: In your transactions, you may see that you have spent almost the entire weekly allowance on sweets. Or Robux. And then it takes longer before you can buy your expensive thing.
school_story_6.1_screen_7_button_2_title: But the money is already gone then!
school_story_6.1_screen_8_title: If you keep track of what you spend, even if you look some time back, you can understand where the money went.
school_story_6.1_screen_8_subtitle: And the next time you get your allowance, it's easier to save more, because you're thinking about it! Smart, huh?
school_story_6.1_screen_9_title: This was my first tip on what to think about when spending. Or rather, when you’ve already spent your money!
school_story_6.1_screen_9_subtitle: There are also some other things that are important to start thinking about early on, when you start managing your own money.
school_story_6.1_screen_9_button_1_title: What Piggy? Where the nearest store is?
school_story_6.1_screen_10_title: Well, it can of course be very tempting to splurge as soon as you get money, but on the planet about saving, you learned how important it is to save.
school_story_6.1_screen_10_subtitle: But you have to be allowed to shop too! If you spend in a smart way, you can save a lot of money.
school_story_6.1_screen_11_title: When you are good at earning, saving and spending money, then you have good and stable personal finances. People who have balanced and stable finances are happier and feel much better than people who don’t.
school_story_6.1_screen_11_button_1_titl: Yes I understand, hate being without money
school_story_6.1_screen_11_button_3_titl: I do not care, I get things
school_story_6.1_screen_11_button_4_titl: A lot to be good at
school_story_6.1_screen_12_title: Run on and practice this first, then I'll go through a little more about how you can become a smart spender!
school_story_6.2_screen_1_title: You are back quickly! Hope it went well.
school_story_6.2_screen_1_subtitle: Now let's talk a little bit about how to think when you want to buy things, or simply use your money.
school_story_6.2_screen_2_title: The big problem with money is that very few people and pigs have large amounts of it.
school_story_6.2_screen_2_subtitle: You only have a certain amount of money you get or earn, and if you don’t save, it runs out. This is not only true while being a kid, but also when you grow up.
school_story_6.2_screen_2_button_1_title: Can't you just take out more?
school_story_6.2_screen_2_button_2_title: Do parents also only receive weekly allowance?
school_story_6.2_screen_2_button_4_title: Can't you just win some more?
school_story_6.2_screen_3_title: The money that parents earn is much more than you get. But they must make it last for all the payments and things to pay for.
school_story_6.2_screen_3_subtitle: The important thing then, is to choose wisely what you spend the money on.
school_story_6.2_screen_3_button_1_title: You can buy cheap food to save!
school_story_6.2_screen_3_button_2_title: I think my parents are stingy
school_story_6.2_screen_4_title: If you are a smart shopper, you buy the most important things first. Then you are sure that you have enough money for what you need.
school_story_6.2_screen_4_subtitle: Only when you have bought the most important things can you think about buying something you want. Especially if you don’t know exactly how long the money will last.
school_story_6.2_screen_5_title: If you look at your transactions and learn about how much money you get and how much you spend, you learn what you can afford and what you shouldn’t buy.
school_story_6.2_screen_5_subtitle: But you don’t have to spend the money that is left after you buy the things you need. You can actually put it away as well. Save it!
school_story_6.2_screen_6_title: When you have money left over and save it instead of spending everything right away, you can buy something more expensive that you want later.
school_story_6.2_screen_6_subtitle: Choosing what you think is most important, and doing that first, is called prioritizing.
school_story_6.2_screen_7_title: Prioritizing is difficult for many adults too, because you do not always know what is most important. But try to remember to do it.
school_story_6.2_screen_7_subtitle: If you try to prioritize when you shop, you will be happy and satisfied in the long run too! Because then you have everything you need.
school_story_6.2_screen_9_title: To be a smart shopper, you need to know and understand that there is a difference between things you <bold>need</bold> and things you <bold>want</bold>.
school_story_6.2_screen_9_subtitle: If you <bold>need</bold> something, it is important in some way. For example, we <bold>need</bold> food, otherwise you can’t manage for very long. What else do you think you <bold>need</bold>?
school_story_6.2_screen_10_title: Yes, you actually need both of those things. Then there are also lots of things you <bold>want</bold>. But you can do pretty well without them. I mean, you don’t freeze your tail off, if you can't buy a new game.
school_story_6.2_screen_10_subtitle: But it can feel very hard sometimes. It is not fun when you can’t buy or get something you really, really want.
school_story_6.2_screen_10_button_1_titl: Yes! I have many things I want
school_story_6.2_screen_10_button_2_titl: I'm pretty ok as it is
school_story_6.2_screen_11_title: If you don't know how, it is probably quite difficult to distinguish between needing or wanting. But if you think honestly, you can probably figure it out.
school_story_6.2_screen_11_subtitle: Think of one thing you want to buy. Do you really <bold>need</bold> it. Is it as important as food for example? Or is it just something you <bold>want</bold>?
school_story_6.2_screen_11_button_2_titl: It's something I want. But very much!
school_story_6.2_screen_12_title: I thought you could figure it out. On the other hand, I don’t know how honestly you answered…
school_story_6.2_screen_12_subtitle: It's not always so simple that one thing is either something you need, or something you want. Sometimes it's both!
school_story_6.2_screen_13_title: It's easier if I take an example. If I ask you this:
school_story_6.2_screen_13_subtitle: Do you <italic>need</italic> a pair of shoes, or do you <italic>want</italic> a pair of shoes?
school_story_6.2_screen_14_title: It's a tricky question! You'll probably notice that it's easier if I tell you more details.
school_story_6.2_screen_14_subtitle: You have no winter shoes, because the old ones have broken. Do you <italic>need</italic> a pair of winter shoes or do you <italic>want</italic> a pair of winter shoes?
school_story_6.2_screen_15_title: In that case, the answer is that you need a pair of winter shoes. Otherwise you may get wet, cold and sick.
school_story_6.2_screen_15_subtitle:
But, you only <italic>need</italic> winter shoes that are warm and that fit. You don’t need expensive winter shoes. 
Do you understand the difference?
school_story_6.2_screen_16_title: Cool brands are more expensive and are something you <italic>want</italic>, you do not need brand shoes.
school_story_6.2_screen_16_subtitle: If you still find it a bit difficult, the challenge is perfect for practice!
school_story_6.3_screen_1_title: I hope the challenge was easy for you! The more you do it, the better you’ll get at deciding which category a thing belongs to.
school_story_6.3_screen_1_subtitle: But maybe you’re already an expert?
school_story_6.3_screen_2_title: Try to be honest with yourself when you think about it. And there is nothing wrong with wanting something, as long as you know why you want to buy something.
school_story_6.3_screen_2_subtitle: Actually, the most important thing to remember is to first spend money on what you need, and then on things you want.
school_story_6.3_screen_3_title: I just got back from the space store! Phew, it's heavy to carry all the bags! I need a space scooter ...
school_story_6.3_screen_3_subtitle: Or no, I <italic>want</italic> a space scooter. Luckily I figured it out myself!
school_story_6.3_screen_3_button_1_title: Nice save! Space store sounds exciting
school_story_6.3_screen_4_title: Well, actually it's a regular grocery store. Although it is located on an asteroid, it is very beautiful. But the cable car there takes a long time ...
school_story_6.3_screen_4_subtitle: Never mind! I thought of you when I shopped, and realized I wanted to tell you a little more about how to think when you spend.
school_story_6.3_screen_5_title: When you want to spend, meaning you want to buy something, you often have to make some choices first.
school_story_6.3_screen_5_subtitle: You need to make some decisions. What do you think you need to decide first?
school_story_6.3_screen_5_button_2_title: If you want to request it as a present
school_story_6.3_screen_5_button_3_title: If you can afford to buy it
school_story_6.3_screen_6_title: First you should decide if you can afford it!
school_story_6.3_screen_6_subtitle: If you can afford to buy what you want, there will be more decisions.
school_story_6.3_screen_7_title: Well, the decisions can be, for example, which model you want of something, which store to shop in or when to buy it.
school_story_6.3_screen_7_subtitle: Or if you want to save money instead!
school_story_6.3_screen_7_button_1_title: Wow, that’s a lot of decisions to make!
school_story_6.3_screen_9_title: It can seem like a lot, but by comparing different alternatives it usually works.
school_story_6.3_screen_9_subtitle: There are strategies for that too, that can help.
school_story_6.3_screen_10_title: A strategy you can use, if you for example want to choose between different models of a phone, is to make a list of pros and cons.
school_story_6.3_screen_10_subtitle: That means you decide what you want and need in a phone, then you write down what the different models have or not.
school_story_6.3_screen_11_title: When you don’t think through a purchase properly before doing it, if you don't make these decisions, you can do what is called an impulse purchase.
school_story_6.3_screen_11_subtitle: That‘s when you buy something as soon as you realize you want it, for example as soon as you see it in the store.
school_story_6.3_screen_12_title: Impulse purchases can be bad, because you haven’t had time to think them through. You may find afterwards that you already have what you bought.
school_story_6.3_screen_12_subtitle: Or you would rather have another model.
school_story_6.3_screen_12_button_1_titl: Oh, hate to regret it afterwards
school_story_6.3_screen_13_title: So in order to be good at spending, to make good purchases that are well planned, it is important to try to think through the decisions beforehand.
school_story_6.3_screen_13_subtitle: The thing to keep in mind is that we are often influenced by others when making decisions.
school_story_6.3_screen_14_title: It could be that we are influenced by peer pressure, by what a sibling thinks or even by advertising.
school_story_6.3_screen_14_subtitle: And do you think it will be a good buy and that you’ll always be happy if your decisions are influenced by others?
school_story_6.3_screen_15_title: A purchase like that doesn’t have to be bad, but if you don’t choose yourself and don’t think through what you want and need, then the chances are greater that you aren’t going to be satisfied.
school_story_6.3_screen_15_subtitle: And isn't it a bit of a waste of money if you regret your purchase afterwards?
school_story_6.3_screen_16_title: Of course you can ask for advice and listen to what others think. But make sure you decide for yourself!
school_story_6.3_screen_16_subtitle: If you think before you shop, your purchases will simply be much better!
school_story_7.1_screen_1_title: Åh vad bra att du är här! Jag har precis loggat ut från min bankapp och jag är riktigt glad.
school_story_7.1_screen_1_subtitle: Jag har fått veta att banken gett mig massa nya pengar på mitt sparkonto. Så najs!
school_story_7.1_screen_2_title: Ja, under förra året sparade jag en massa pengar på mitt sparkonto och nu har jag fått ränta av banken!
school_story_7.1_screen_2_subtitle: Behövde inte pengarna ändå, så förde över massor till sparkontot.
school_story_7.1_screen_2_button_1_title: Men varför ger banken dig pengar?
school_story_7.1_screen_3_title: Ja förlåt, jag var så uppspelt av min ränta att jag glömde vad vi skulle prata om: Hur banker fungerar!
school_story_7.1_screen_4_title: Det vanligaste sättet att använda en bank är att låta banken förvara ens pengar.
school_story_7.1_screen_4_subtitle: Förr i tiden, när vi mest använde mynt och sedlar, var banken en bra förvaringsplats för pengar man inte behövde den närmaste tiden.
school_story_7.1_screen_5_title: För även om sedlar är lättare än mynt, så får man inte plats med hur många som helst i fickan.
school_story_7.1_screen_5_subtitle: Istället satte du in pengarna på banken, som förvarade pengarna åt dig tills du behövde ta ut dem igen.
school_story_7.1_screen_5_button_1_title: Typ ta ut i en bankomat
school_story_7.1_screen_6_title: Nuförtiden ligger pengarna lagrade i datorer och digitala system istället för i pengarum...
school_story_7.1_screen_6_subtitle: ... och man kan sköta nästan alla sina bankärenden i en app eller på internet.
school_story_7.1_screen_7_title: Banken är glad att få ha dina pengar hos sig, för det betyder att banken faktiskt lånar pengarna av <italic>dig</italic>!
school_story_7.1_screen_7_subtitle: Banken ger dig därför ofta betalt för att pengarna förvaras på banken.
school_story_7.1_screen_9_title: Precis! Ränta! Du har gjort banken en tjänst och då tjänar du ränta.
school_story_7.1_screen_9_subtitle: Eftersom många människor förvarar sina pengar hos banken, får banken väldigt mycket pengar.
school_story_7.1_screen_10_title: Men om banken bara betalade ut ränta skulle ju banken inte klara sig. Banken är ett företag så de måste tjäna pengar också.
school_story_7.1_screen_11_title: Banken tjänar genom att låna ut pengar till andra människor och ta ut en avgift för lånet.
school_story_7.1_screen_11_subtitle: Kommer du ihåg vad den avgiften heter?
school_story_7.1_screen_13_title: Ja, ordet ränta kan man använda till mycket! Ränta kan man alltså både få av banken och behöva betala till banken.
school_story_7.1_screen_13_subtitle: Man får pengar av att spara hos banken och man ger banken ränta när man lånar pengar av dem.
school_story_7.1_screen_14_title: Jag ska förklara mer om hur lånen och sparandet fungerar snart, men det viktigaste är att du förstår vad banken jobbar med.
school_story_7.1_screen_14_subtitle: Att förvara pengar och ge ut lån.
school_story_7.1_screen_15_title: De som jobbar på banken är också utbildade i detta med pengar, så de kan ge råd och tips på hur man bäst ska hantera sina pengar.
school_story_7.1_screen_15_subtitle: Men banken är ändå ett företag, så även om de har mycket bra tips ska man komma ihåg att de också behöver tjäna pengar.
school_story_7.1_screen_16_title: Allt banksnack har gjort mig lite trött…
school_story_7.1_screen_16_subtitle: …gör utmaningen så länge så kan vi prata mer efter jag vilat!
school_story_7.2_screen_1_title: Välkommen tillbaka. Nu har återhämtat mig lite från allt banksnack.
school_story_7.2_screen_1_subtitle: Jag softar i min månstia. Den ligger i omloppsbana runt en gasjätte. Det är så fint här.
school_story_7.2_screen_2_title: Månstian är jättefin. Jag köpte den förra året och nu bor jag här.Det är så avslappnande med utsikten!
school_story_7.2_screen_2_subtitle: Men vet du? Jag hade inte ens tillräckligt med pengar när jag köpte den.
school_story_7.2_screen_3_title: I vanliga fall har du helt rätt! Man ska inte köpa något man inte har råd med. Men denna gång var det medvetet…
school_story_7.2_screen_3_subtitle: …för hade jag försökt spara ihop till månstian hade det tagit mig superlång tid.
school_story_7.2_screen_3_button_1_title: Ja hus är dyra att köpa
school_story_7.2_screen_4_title: Så lång tid att om jag hade klippt grannens gräs varje helg…
school_story_7.2_screen_4_subtitle: … så hade jag fått göra det i över 50 år för att ha råd! Och ibland måste vi köpa något som vi inte har alla pengar till, saker som kostar mycket pengar.
school_story_7.2_screen_4_button_1_title: Man klipper inte gräs på vintern
school_story_7.2_screen_4_button_2_title: Ja, man måste ju bo någonstans
school_story_7.2_screen_5_title: Om det är något man faktiskt behöver, som exempelvis en bostad, så behöver man ta ett lån!
school_story_7.2_screen_5_subtitle: Oftast är det banken som ger ut lånen.
school_story_7.2_screen_6_title: När man fått ett lån av banken får man betala ränta på lånet. Detta är avgiften man betalar för lånetjänsten som banken erbjuder
school_story_7.2_screen_6_button_2_title: Och du får stian för lånet
school_story_7.2_screen_7_title: Det är bra om vi går igenom lite mer om ränta, för det är verkligen en bra sak att förstå för att ha Finansiella Superskills!
school_story_7.2_screen_7_subtitle: Räntan anges i procent. Vet du hur man räknar med procent?
school_story_7.2_screen_9_title: Procent är ett sätt att förklara hur stor del av något som man pratar om.
school_story_7.2_screen_9_subtitle: 100% är allt av något. En hel tårta till exempel är 100%.
school_story_7.2_screen_10_title: Om tårtan är uppskuren i 10 bitar, då är var bit 10%. 100% delat på 10 = 10%
school_story_7.2_screen_10_subtitle: Tar man 5 bitar så är det 50%. Halva tårtan.
school_story_7.2_screen_11_title: Om vi hade lånat tårtan av banken och haft 10% ränta, hade vi fått ge en tårtbit till banken varje år för lånet.
school_story_7.2_screen_11_subtitle: Om räntan var 20% hade vi fått ge dem två.
school_story_7.2_screen_12_title: Galaxsparbanken, som lånade mig pengar för att köpa månstian, tar 2% ränta för mitt lån.
school_story_7.2_screen_12_subtitle: Det betyder att jag varje år måste betala 2% av pengarna jag lånat i avgift.
school_story_7.2_screen_13_title: Det är ett stort ansvar att låna så mycket pengar, men har man ett jobb och balanserad ekonomi går det bra.
school_story_7.2_screen_13_subtitle: Och tack vare banken har jag haft råd att flytta hemifrån och ordna en egen stia. Det är så värt!
school_story_7.2_screen_14_title: Så lån kan vara något bra, eftersom man behöver lån för att köpa de dyra sakerna som man faktiskt behöver.
school_story_7.2_screen_14_subtitle: Men man ska inte låna för saker man inte behöver. Det kostar bara extra. Och man måste ju ha råd med räntan såklart!
school_story_7.2_screen_15_title: Jag hoppas du känner att du förstår lite mer om bankernas lån nu. Gör utmaningen så hörs vi sedan!
school_story_7.3_screen_1_title: Nu tänkte jag vi ska prata om hur man sparar hos banken. Det är riktigt kul, för då <italics>tjänar</italics> man ränta.
school_story_7.3_screen_2_title: Bankerna ger ut ränta en gång om året för det man sparat på sitt sparkonto. Det räknas ut på samma sätt som låneräntan.
school_story_7.3_screen_3_title: Säg att du har 1 000 pb sparade på ditt sparkonto som ger 1% i ränta…
school_story_7.3_screen_3_subtitle: … då får du 10 pb i ränta när året är slut! För 1% av 1 000 är 10.
school_story_7.3_screen_4_title: Det kan tyckas lite, men banken har nästan alltid en låg sparränta.
school_story_7.3_screen_4_subtitle: Men det finns ett knep för att göra sparräntan högre!
school_story_7.3_screen_5_title: Om du lovar banken att inte ta ut dina pengar alls under en viss tid, så ger banken dig högre sparränta.
school_story_7.3_screen_5_subtitle: Detta är bra för banken, för då kan de räkna med att dina pengar ligger kvar under tiden du lovat inte röra pengarna.
school_story_7.3_screen_6_title: Om du exempelvis lovar att inte röra pengarna på 3 år, så kanske banken ger dig en sparränta på 3%.
school_story_7.3_screen_6_subtitle: Då skulle du tjäna 30 pb, istället för 10 pb, på dina 1 000 pb på sparkontot.
school_story_7.3_screen_8_title: Problemet är att du inte får använda pengarna alls under tiden de är låsta. Så man måste planera.
school_story_7.3_screen_8_subtitle: Men tänker man smart, så kan man tjäna mycket!
school_story_7.3_screen_8_button_1_title: Jobbigt att inte kunna använda pengarna!
school_story_7.3_screen_9_title: På banken finns ofta olika typer av konton. Sparkontot är det som oftast ger ränta, men man har ofta andra konton också.
school_story_7.3_screen_9_subtitle: Till exempel ett transaktionskonto. Dit får man sin lön. Man kan också använda kontot för att överföra pengar till andra.
school_story_7.3_screen_10_title: Transaktionskontot kallas ibland för allkonto eller lönekonto. Oftast får man ingen ränta där.
school_story_7.3_screen_10_subtitle: Till transaktionskontot kan man koppla ett bankkort. Då kan man köpa saker och banken gör överföringen från kontot automatiskt.
school_story_7.3_screen_11_title: Men det är på ett sparkonto man ska ha sina pengar, om man vill ha ränta.
school_story_7.3_screen_11_subtitle: Och eftersom bankkortet oftast är kopplat till transaktionskontot, är det säkrare att ha största delen av sina pengar på sparkontot.
school_story_7.3_screen_11_button_1_titl: Om kortet blir stulet, jag fattar!
school_story_7.3_screen_12_title: Precis! Och du? Visste du att du kan få ränta på pengarna i Gimiappen också? Det heter bonus!
school_story_7.3_screen_12_subtitle: Om du har veckopengen i Gimiappen så kan du be dina föräldrar om en bonus. Då tjänar du på ditt sparande.
school_story_7.3_screen_13_title: Nu ska jag räkna på sparräntan jag fått av Galaxsparbanken. Du kan köra utmaningen så länge. Lycka till!
school_story_7.4_screen_1_title: Jag berättade inte allt om sparkontona senast!
school_story_7.4_screen_2_title: Ville bara att du skulle ha bra koll på grunderna först! Men nu ska du få veta lite experthemligheter!
school_story_7.4_screen_2_subtitle: Man kan tjäna riktigt bra genom att spara länge. För då får man <italics>ränta på ränta</italics>!
school_story_7.4_screen_2_button_3_title: Nu har du blivit tokig Piggy
school_story_7.4_screen_3_title: Ja, jag vet. Det låter snurrigt, men jag ska förklara.
school_story_7.4_screen_3_subtitle: Tänk dig att du sparar 1,000pb på ett sparkonto där du får 1% i ränta. 10% av 1, 000 är 10
school_story_7.4_screen_4_title: Räntan betalas ut en gång, och då har du ju 1,010pb. Nästa gång räntan ska betalas ut, så räknas det på den nya summan.
school_story_7.4_screen_4_subtitle: Så då får du ju mer utbetalt i ränta varje år, för att dina pengar växer!
school_story_7.4_screen_4_button_2_title: Sparar man länge blir det mycket!
school_story_7.4_screen_5_title: Detta kallas för ”ränta på ränta”. Sparar du i flera år, kan du tjäna mycket.
school_story_7.4_screen_5_subtitle: Speciellt om du dessutom betalar in mer pengar att spara när du kan.
school_story_7.4_screen_6_title: Så ränta på ränta är riktigt bra. Men då måste man spara långsiktigt. Det är bra om man vill spara för något långt senare.
school_story_7.4_screen_6_subtitle: Sammanfattningsvis, så ju <bold>mer</bold> och ju <bold>längre tid</bold> du sparar med ränta, desto mer pengar tjänar du..
school_story_7.4_screen_8_title: Jag vill berätta en annan grej för dig också.
school_story_7.4_screen_8_subtitle: När jag började spara hos Galaxsparbanken var jag lite orolig. För tänk om Galaxsparbanken försvinner? Vad händer då med mina pengar?
school_story_7.4_screen_8_button_2_title: Ingen vits att oroa sig eller?
school_story_7.4_screen_9_title: Galaxsparbanken kan ju råka ut för en eldsvåda och brinna ned. Eller så kanske Galaxsparbanken får slut på pengar och lägger ned!
school_story_7.4_screen_9_subtitle: Och då skulle ju mina pengar brinna upp eller försvinna. Inte bra alls!
school_story_7.4_screen_10_title: Som tur är finns det ett skydd för detta.
school_story_7.4_screen_10_subtitle: De flesta länder har något som heter ”insättningsgaranti”.
school_story_7.4_screen_11_title: Insättningsgarantin innebär att någon annan än banken, oftast staten som styr landet, lovar att hjälpa till om banken försvinner
school_story_7.4_screen_11_subtitle: Staten lovar att ge dig de pengar du förlorar ifall något händer med dem när du sparat dem på en bank. Det kallas en garanti.
school_story_7.4_screen_12_title: Dessutom är det ganska ovanligt att banker får slut på pengar. Nuförtiden kan inte heller en eldsvåda göra så att pengarna försvinner.
school_story_7.4_screen_13_title: Precis! Pengarna ligger inte i sedelbuntar som förr, så det är inte så stor fara.
school_story_7.4_screen_13_subtitle: Ja, så jag oroar mig inte längre, skulle något hända så har jag insättningsgarantin. Den är toppen!.
school_story_7.4_screen_14_title: Det var allt om banker! Nu vet du lite mer om både sparkonton, transaktionskonton och lån.
school_story_7.4_screen_14_subtitle: Kör utmaningen och tanka sedan raketen, så kör vi till nästa planet!
school_story_8.1_screen_1_subtitle: I wondered for a long time what currencies really are.
school_story_8.1_screen_2_title: The answer I learned is that it's just different kinds of money!
school_story_8.1_screen_2_subtitle: Currency is the word that describes what type of money that is used in a specific country.
school_story_8.1_screen_3_title: You’ve already learnt how and why people started using money.
school_story_8.1_screen_3_subtitle: When people used coins of gold and silver, they could use them all over the world, as their weight decided their worth.
school_story_8.1_screen_4_title: But when it became common to exchange coins for bills, money started to look different in different countries.
school_story_8.1_screen_5_title: When talking about different types of money you use the word currency.
school_story_8.1_screen_5_subtitle: Most countries have their own currency.
school_story_8.1_screen_6_title: But there are also currencies that are used by more than one country.
school_story_8.1_screen_6_subtitle: Dollars and Euros are examples of currencies used by several countries as domestic currency.
school_story_8.1_screen_7_title: Let's go back to the times when bills were still new.
school_story_8.1_screen_7_subtitle: To control money and to make sure it could not be faked or forged,governments  started central banks. And they centralized the currency.
school_story_8.1_screen_9_title: This means that some agency in the country, usually the central bank of the state, took over the control of making the money. So regular banks couldn't decide that anymore.
school_story_8.1_screen_9_subtitle: The central bank decided how much the different bills and coins would be worth and how the money would look. And also how much money to print.
school_story_8.1_screen_10_title: They then created places called mints. The mint was, and still is, the place where the government makes the money.
school_story_8.1_screen_11_title: Through the years the people working at central banks have come up with clever ways of manufacturing the bills and coins.
school_story_8.1_screen_11_subtitle: They make them so it is very hard to forge or fake them.
school_story_8.1_screen_11_button_1_titl: So not like toilet paper anymore
school_story_8.1_screen_12_title: No, not like toilet paper anymore!
school_story_8.1_screen_12_subtitle: Quite a difference between the bills we have today and hand written receipts right?
school_story_8.1_screen_14_title: Sorry I didn't see what you answered! I got distracted by my cat Fido...
school_story_8.1_screen_14_subtitle: But the correct answer is: Money!
school_story_8.1_screen_14_button_4_titl: I have ants in my pants
school_story_8.2_screen_1_title: Let's go back to talking about the countries starting central banks.
school_story_8.2_screen_2_title: The countries around the world started governmental central banks, to control the value of money.
school_story_8.2_screen_2_subtitle: It was needed as more of the hand written receipts were used instead of coins.
school_story_8.2_screen_3_title: So with all this, it once again became harder to trade and buy things between countries.
school_story_8.2_screen_4_title: A merchant in Germany, for example, could not know if a piece of paper from Sweden was worth anything.
school_story_8.2_screen_4_subtitle: Or if it was just regular paper.
school_story_8.2_screen_5_title: So on top of making bills that are hard to copy and to centralize the currency,
school_story_8.2_screen_5_subtitle: they also had to come up with a system so that people could understand the relationship between different currencies.
school_story_8.2_screen_6_title: If you go to Spain and have 10pb, how much is that in their country? In their currency?
school_story_8.2_screen_6_subtitle: To answer this you need to look at the exchange rates of their currency.
school_story_8.2_screen_8_title: I went to Europe recently, and traveled around there. I've always liked to travel.
school_story_8.2_screen_8_subtitle: Now I have a bunch of currencies from different countries to unpack... I collect them!
school_story_8.2_screen_9_title: Remember that I told you that most countries have their own currency?
